11312.content:
Stephan had finally had enough of his school. The mind-numbingly dull lessons, the patronising teachers, the dumb kids - especially the older ones who thought they could push him around. But no more! Things were about to change and the Principal's announcement meant that everybody was neatly collected in one place.

Instead of going to the hall Stephan headed out through the entrance. He walked to the school gate and turned round to look one last time at the various buildings outlined against the sky. Then there was a flash as Stephan clicked his fingers and exerted his power once more. In an instant all the buildings had vanished; all that could be seen now was a neat rectangle of earth, several hundred feet across, where the school had once stood. Stephan climbed down and strolled lazily across the exposed soil. His keen eyes picked out a small object sitting exactly at the center of the rectangle. He reached the little thing and stood over it, positioning himself so that he had one foot on either side of it. The soles of his sneakers dwarfed the tiny object completely.

It was the school. The little cluster of buildings, along with the playground, car park, and sports field had been reduced to a size not much bigger than a postage stamp. The whole thing was easily small enough to fit comfortably in the palm of his hand. And inside were roughly 1000 teeny people.

1133.content:
Stephan was delighted with his new-found power. He could now shrink down anybody he chose with a mere thought. And make them not just small, but incredibly minute, microscopic even. For a kid that age the thought was utterly intoxicating. All the people who bored or annoyed him, anybody who caught his eye, all completely in his power!

Then an idea suddenly popped into his head.

"All the people..." he murmured with a sly grin on his face. "I wonder exactly how many people I could shrink down and capture, just by thinking about it..."

Ten? A hundred? A thousand? More!?

As he continued to daydream his thoughts returned to one of his earlier classes: a particularly boring one on geography and economics.

"Perfect! I know exactly how to liven things up!" he smirked. Then he concentrated and snapped his fingers.

Instantly Stephan was back in that earlier class, sitting on his own at a desk at the back of the room. He looked around, but nobody seemed to have noticed anything unusual. His new god-like powers had brought him back without any disruption.

It was just as boring as the first time he sat through it. The teacher was droning on about New York and its role as a economic and tourist center, how many people lived and worked there, and blah, blah, blah...

So instead of listening to the man's useless speech Stephen held his hand out in front of him and concentrated...

* * * * * *

The inhabitants of New York were going about their lives as usual when there was a sudden rumbling sound and the ground began to shake. Before they could react properly there was a flash of light. As it faded they realised that the sun and sky had disappeared, to be replaced by a featureless grey expanse countless miles above them. The light now seemed to be coming from long glowing strips stretching along this strange expanse, but they were simply too far away to be seen clearly. Before they could speculate further another impossibly huge shape rose above the skyline, blocking everything from view. As the shadow fell over the city millions of people started screaming....

* * * * * *

Stephan smiled as he looked down at his hand. It was no longer empty. There, in the middle of his palm was a teeny grey and silver shape, no more than an inch across. He brought the little thing up to his face for a closer inspection. It was incredibly tiny, but he could make out intricate little patterns running across its surface like grids. There were even a couple of minute strands of blue to be seen. Stephan glanced up and compared those patterns with the map of the city that was on display at the front of the class. It was a perfect match. His plan had worked. He now had the city of New York and its millions of inhabitants cupped in the palm of his hand!

"Time to meet your new God," he whispered. His clear blue eyes glittered with excitement.

11331.content:
The teacher is still busy with the lesson with the rest of the class watching him. Stephan can hardly keep from laughing at the thought that none of them realises that the subject of the lesson - one of the world's largest and most important cities - is actually just a few feet away from them, reduced to the size of a toy. The teacher has a larger audience than he could possibly imagine!

"Don't worry, I've got you all to myself," the boy sneered down at the terrified inhabitants. "I could crush you..." - he starts to close his hand around the micro-city, causing huge chunks of land and entire neighbourhoods around the edges to break apart and crumble, falling down into the deep canyons that are the lines running across his palm - "...or I can keep you as slaves. Or maybe snacks." The boy licked his lips dramatically.

But instead the boy-god contented himself with merely picking up a pencil and using it to start poking at the tiny city. Everything he touched with the pencil tip was obliterated: houses, office blocks, roads and bridges.

"Man, you microbes sure don't know how to build properly. Look how fragile all your stuff is"

Stephan held the teeny tiny city up to his lips and blew gently on it. A stream of barely visible particles of dust drifted over the edge of his hand to fall down onto the desk or onto his crotch. They were crowds of microscopic people, thousands of them, along with their vehicles and homes.

"Heh, I guess you can't handle high winds either. Hope you know how to deal with floods"

The boy started gathering a ball of saliva ready to drop down onto the miniaturized city, but before he could do so -

"STEPHAN!"

It was the teacher. He'd finally noticed that Stephan had other things on his mind. The other kids all turned round in their chairs to look at him.

The teacher smirked arrogantly at him, always ready to humiliate any student who tried to fool around in class, and spoke to him with exaggerated politeness.

"Well, Stephan, perhaps you'd like to share with the rest of the class exactly what you think is more deserving of your attention than today's lesson?"

On previous occasions Stephan might have given a surly and reluctant response, but not today! Today he could do anything!

Still holding the tiny city of New York casually in the palm of his hand, Stephan put on his most innocent expression as he answered the teacher.

"I was just thinking about the lesson and how much more interesting it might be if we could take a trip to the city to see it all for ourselves."

The teacher frowned. He'd been expecting a more insolent reply from the teenage troublemaker, but his response suggested he was actually showing some kind of interest in the lesson for once. Still, he couldn't let Stephan get the better of him in front of the other kids, and what was he holding in his hand anyway?

Deliberately making his tone sound as patronising as possible the teacher answered:

"Well, Stephan, I'm sure we'd all love to take a trip out to the city to see the sights and enjoy ourselves, but you know full well that the school doesn't have the money or resources to send a whole class to New York just because one kid thinks it might be a good idea." He chuckled and the rest of the class laughed obediently along with him. "Now, what is that you've got in your hand?"

Instead of blushing with embarrassment as the teacher had intended Stephan grinned broadly.

"What, this little thing? Oh, it's nothing much. I just thought that if it was too difficult for us to go to New York, then maybe I should bring the city here instead." The thirteen-year-old looked down at the terrified little metropolis with a look of amusement. "I thought you said it was supposed to be a really big city. It looks pretty teeny to me. I could probably squash the whole thing under my thumb." Still smiling, Stephan looked back up at the teacher, waiting to see his reaction.

Sure enough, it was the teacher's face that started to flush, first from confusion, then with anger. Just what was this dumb kid playing at? He peered more closely at the tiny object that Stephan was holding out for him to see. It was irregularly-shaped, ragged around the edges like it had been ripped out of something larger, but there was something about it.... It was almost too small to notice but was one shape that looked almost like Manhattan.... and that minute speck of green - it was in just the right place to be Central Park! It couldn't be... the boy had to be playing some kind of joke on him!

Stephan smiled again. "Maybe you should take a closer look. Hey, why don't you show the rest of the class around?"

Before the teacher had a chance to respond the boy had snapped his fingers. There was a brief flash and he found himself standing somewhere completely different. Completely disorientated, he looked around and saw the rest of the class nearby looking similarly dazed. Stephan, however, was nowhere to be found. Then the teacher looked up and gasped in surprise: they were standing on Liberty Island, at the base of the Statue of Liberty! However, something was badly wrong: the statue appeared to be damaged, with chunks missing and cracks running across its surface. The water around the island was unsually turbulent, almost as though it was draining away somewhere. He could even see a large cargo vessel being pulled along helplessly by the current. All around the city he could see damage. The skyline had been reshaped, and there was a huge groove running through the middle off into the distance, as though some colossal object had touched down and scraped a line through the city.

A sudden rumble of thunder and a blast of hot wind caught his attention and sent the students into a panic. The teacher looked up to see Stephan's face smiling down on him! He was simply colossal! The teacher couldn't even begin to guess how big he must be, but from a comparison of the tallest skyscrapers with the size of the boy's lips he had the uncomfortable feeling that the entire city could be casually placed inside the teenager's mouth like a small piece of candy!

There was another rumble of thunder: it was Stephan laughing. Then the boy spoke, his voice almost deafening in its volume.

"You see, I told you I'd bring New York to you! Guess it's too bad I had to shrink you down to fit you inside it, but I have to say it's pretty awesome being able to hold an entire city in my hand like this!"

The teacher didn't reply. Instead he felt his legs turning to jelly with utter fear. He thought about just how tiny that "thing" in Stephan's hand had been. Definitely no bigger than an inch across, maybe even smaller... And that little trinket had been New York!? His throat tightened up as he tried to imagine all the people who lived in that city, how tiny they must now be. How tiny he must be! Millions of humans, reduced in an instant to microscopic scale! And this boy, Stephan the troublemaker, was now like a god to them! He could do anything...

The boy-god spoke again: "I think we should continue the lesson now. Maybe things will be a bit more interesting! What was it you were talking about? Tourism and economy? Which one shall we choose?"
113311.title: Microscopic school trip

choices: Stephan gets home and torments the tiny city even more
Stephan decides to collect a few more "playthings" on the way...
1133111.content:
With the teacher and the other students now reduced to microscopic size and trapped inside the stolen metropolis there was no reason to remain at school for any longer. Stephan was the one now in charge and ready to teach the entire world a lesson...

For a brief moment he considered showing his new toy to some of his friends so they could play with it together - but only for a moment. Gods are capricious - especially ones that are 13-year-old kids - and Stephan had already changed his mind about what he was going to do with what was now the tiniest city on Earth. Perhaps he would invite his friends round later, but for now the teenage megalomaniac planned to give his captives a special guided tour of their new home - his bedroom!

In theory Stephan could have used his new powers to transport himself home with a mere snap of his fingers, but he wanted to take the opportunity to humiliate his pets further so he strolled along the corridor to where his locker was situated. When he got there he found a couple of jocks that had cornered some poor dork and were about to beat him up. A couple of seconds later the bullies found themselves standing in the vast expanse of the corridor floor, staring up at a pair of towering sneakers. Stephan scooped up the two terrified half-inch tall boys and handed them to the dork, telling him: "Here, do whatever you want with them. Crush them; eat them; feed them to your goldfish; anything you like. But if you tell anybody else what happened then you'll find yourself ending up the same way..." The dork didn't need to be told twice. He flashed Stephan a shy smile of gratitude and wonder, then scampered off down the corridor, dropping the two tiny jocks into his pocket as he went.

Finally alone, the boy-god opened his locker and took out his sports bag. He'd had a gym class earlier and his kit was inside. It was a particularly warm day and the exercise had taken its inevitable toll: as Stephan unzipped the bag the smell of perspiration and stale running shoes rose like a cloud of pollution from a poorly-maintained power station. Taking the teeny city of New York between his thumb and forefinger he carefully placed it deep inside one of the sneakers. "That should keep you safe - at least for now" he muttered with satisfaction. Then it occurred to him to stuff something into the opening of the sneaker, just for extra "protection". He picked up a sock - and then had a better idea. Apart from the shoes the main source of the aroma was his white sports shirt with its two dark, telltale stains of moisture under the armpits. Stephan folded the shirt so that one of the stains was outermost and then pushed it into the opening of the sneaker contained the city. Already cowering in the near-darkness of the footwear, the surviving population could only watch in terror and disgust as the sweat-drenched fabric, covering an area far larger than the entire city, descended and came to rest almost touching the tops of the skyscrapers. As the temperature and humidity quickly rose to unbearable levels the bag was zipped shut; the metropolis was rocked by earthquakes as the sports bag was lifted up and casually slung over the boy's shoulder.

Pausing briefly to crush underfoot a teacher who challenged him for leaving without a pass, Stephan walked out of the school and slowly made his way home. Much to his satisfaction he soon noticed the people around him talking in shocked tones about the sudden mysterious disappearance of New York. Passing by an electrical store he noticed the television sets in the window were all displaying the breaking news, with aerial images of the barren landscape where an entire city had once stood. Stephan could hardly keep from laughing at the thought of how the missing city was closer than anybody could imagine: he had millions of people inside his sports bag, now his own personal playthings, just inches away from the rest of the world. He could hardly wait to get home to toy with them all...
1133111.title: Stephan carries off the tiny city...

choices: Stephan Takes His Shoes and Socks Off For Some Worship
11331111.content:
Stephan approached his neighborhood, it was an extremely hot day, and the T-shirt he was wearing was already beginning to show signs of underarm sweat. Inside the sneakers and socks he was wearing, his feet felt like he had walked through a puddle and the water had soaked through his shoes and into his socks. This was not the case however, he was simply dripping wet with perspiration, worse than he was in gym. But through the soaking wet bangs of his hair that were over his eyes, Stephan could see his house, his mom and dad weren't home this early of course, plus it was Friday, so he had all day, and the entire weekend to experience his new status as Stephan: God of NYC.

Once he entered through the door with his house key, Stephan sighed and entered the cool air conditioned house. Stephan stood in front of the AC, holding his arms above his head and allowing the cold air to blow his hot pits off. Though by doing this he made himself aware of the pungent odor he was now giving off after his long walk. "Meh, oh well....I'll take a shower later." The young god said to himself as he picked up his bag and bounded upstairs to his messy room, locking his bedroom door behind him and making sure to close the blinds on the window after turning on the light.

"Now...lets get down to business." Stephan chuckled as he unzipped the bag, pulling out the sneaker with the moist shirt hanging out of it. He pulled the garment out and peered inside with his enormous eye.

The people inside were coughing from the mixed reek of armpit smell and built up foot odor, and when the shirt was removed and replaced with Stephan's eye they all screamed in terror and some began pleading.

Stephan looked in upon the pleading New York and chuckled darkly, "Yeah...I like being begged, keep doing that! And maybe I won't put the shoe on!"

All together, a chorus of voices began pleading in different ways, many of them falling to their knees as if in prayer to the giant thirteen year old. This made the boy's ego swell, he actually had an entire city in his shoe and at his mercy, they were begging him to let them out of his smelly shoe! Stephan finally decided to take them out, and put them to work.

Stephan reached inside the shoe with his thumb and index finger, plucking out the tiny city and placing it on the carpet as he sat high above on his bed. "Now you puny insects, I've got a job for you!"
11331111.title: Stephan: New York's New God

113311111.content:
Stephan paused for a moment, allowing the suspense to build. He knew the entire population must be wondering just what a 13-year old boy could possibly want with a city the size of a single M&M candy. He loved how puny and helpless the tiny metropolis appeared, resting on the giant carpet fibers; it occurred to him that by his captives' scale his room would seem like an entire new world, mysterious and filled with danger. Not just New York, but the entire U.S. could easily fit on the floor of his bedroom like some kind of bizarre model set. "Maybe later." he snickered to himself...

He pulled off one sneaker and carelessly let it drop down perilously close to the city. New York was shaken by the titanic impacts as it bounced slightly and came to rest, all too close. Another couple of centimeters and it might have rolled over them.... A few seconds later the other sneaker plunged from the heavens, landing even closer than the first. So close, in fact, that one of the dirt-smeared laces was flung outwards, almost hitting the city and finally settling down almost against its edge. The microscopic population was once more reminded of how truly minute they had become by the sight of the miles-wide lace towering above the skyline.

The terror wasn't over. Now Stephan began to remove his socks, one by one. They were so drenched in sweat that he had to peel each one slowly away from his foot. Then they two were casually tossed away, these impossibly huge objects landing in a messy pile that rose higher than any mountain next to the teeny metropolis.

"Wow... that's so much better," exclaimed Stephan, flexing his toes with delight. His feet felt able to breathe now. However, there were some annoying little patches of lint and fluff left stuck to his skin and the boy knew exactly how to deal with them...

Once again New York was filled with the sound of screams as the thirteen-year old's hand descended from above to grab them. The world's most famous city was just a toy, pinched between his thumb and forefinger, as he effortlessly picked it up and held it next to his big toe. Thunder rumbled above them as the city's newest deity spoke his commands:

"Listen up microbes: it's hot and my feet need attention. I guess I could just take a shower, but somehow I don't think you'd survive very long if I took you in there with me!" Cruel laughter echoed through the heavens, and millions of people cringed. New York was not much bigger than a drop of water on its own; nobody wanted to imagine just how colossal and powerful a shower might be...

But Stephan continued: "So what you're going to do is remove all of the crud from on my feet and under my nails. If you succeed then I may reward you. If not.... I may have to reconsider whether you are worthy of a god such as me." To demonstrate his point Stephan increased the pressure of his fingertips very, very slightly, making the city shake and groan. It was clear to everybody that all he had to do was rub his finger and thumb together gently and the centuries-old city would be ground into dust in a fraction of a second - just a little smudge of dirt on his skin.

Stephan set the tiny city down on the nail of his big toe: New York was now resting on what seemed to be a huge flat plateau. The edges of the city were heavily damaged from where the metropolis had been torn away from the landscape; countless cars, homes, and people had already fallen off to become lost on Stephan's desk at school; in the grooves running across the palm of his hand; under his fingernails; on his clothing. Like grains of sand (though infinitely smaller), microscopic people were now scattered all over his body. As he absently ran his hand through his hair, another ten or twenty thousand were transferred onto his scalp... Nevertheless, those remaining in the city worked to form impromptu ramps down on the surface of Stephan's toenail; nobody had yet come up with any idea how to move any of the mountain-sized piece of lint, assuming they could even reach them. The miasma of Stephan's feet was almost unbearable, and his skin, glistening with sweat, presented a treacherous, sticky trap...

Stephan, settled himself down in his chair, took out his DS, and began playing. He knew the New Yorkers had no chance of fulfilling his commands, but he wanted some time to relax and think up some suitable punishments for them...
113311111.title: Stephan Takes His Shoes and Socks Off...

choices: He decides to crush them inside his armpit
1133111111.content:
Stephan finished the game he was playing and snapped shut the DS. It was time to turn his attention to even more pleasant matters. Roughly half an hour had passed and he wanted to check up on the progress of his new, microscopic slaves. He glanced down at his bare foot and smiled at the small grey smudge resting in the middle of the nail of his big toe. Anyone else would have mistaken it for a smear of dirt, but of course it was actually one of the world’s largest and most important cities—reduced to an utterly minute scale, along with the many millions of people who lived in it!

Taking care not to dislodge the helpless little thing, Stephan leaned back in his chair and eased his foot up onto the desk in front of him so he could get a better look. He didn’t really need one, but for effect he clicked his fingers and a magnifying glass appeared on the desk. The boy picked it up and held it over his nail. Millions of people looked up to see an immense glass shape appear above them, and through it a single eye loomed terrifyingly large, magnified to an overwhelming scale. New York was just a mote by comparison...

Stephan inspected his toenail. The metropolis still appeared so tiny, even when magnified, but he could see now the incredible detail of its layout: countless streets and roads; neighbourhoods and city blocks; skyscrapers and homes. A populated area miles across—compressed into a tiny little patch, smaller than a boy's nail. Next to it was something even tinier: an incredibly faint line, even thinner than a human hair, stretching from the edge of the city to the back of his nail, where a teeny little speck of coloured fluff was stuck. The line was a whole convoy of trucks and construction vehicles. They were so minuscule that they could scarcely be seen, even with the magnifying glass, but there were so many of them that they appeared as a tiny dark thread, stretching out over a distance of at least five miles. Clearly they were heading out to move the speck of lint, but it was simply too immense for them. Stephan chuckled at their futile struggles and decided to help them out. He pursed his lips and blew softly on the lint. It immediately flew off and disappeared somewhere down on the floor. Unfortunately the sudden gust of wind, more powerful than any hurricane, also blew away most of the convoy. Hundreds of trucks and cranes, most of them weighing well over 10 tons at least, were simply carried off like particles of dust. As for the rest... Stephan licked his fingertip and touched it to the patch of nail next to the city. The remaining vehicles and people were instantly snatched up in the powerful adhesive and carried miles into the air. The 13-year old studied his fingertip with the magnifying glass, taking note of the minute dots that had now appeared—and then he lazily stuck his finger into his mouth and sucked it clean...

“SO!!!”

The accusation echoed through the world-sized region. It hardly seemed conceivable that this colossal space was nothing more than a teenager’s messy bedroom, carefully locked so its occupant could have some privacy while playing with his toys...

“It seems even that modest task was beyond you. I guess I’ll have to punish you after all. Now what would be most appropriate?”

Stephan made a show of pondering the question, even though he already knew exactly what he intended. He wanted to make things as humiliating as possible for the city and its populace.

“When my dog was a puppy and left a mess we had to train him to stop by rubbing his nose in it. I guess I’ll have to do something similar with you.”

Once again the Hand of the Boy-God descended and picked the tiny city as if it was just a little trinket. He placed it carefully in the palm of his left hand: an even larger expanse than the toenail, but covered in large hills and deep valleys. Then with his right hand he reached down and wiped a particularly juicy piece of crud from between his big toe and the next. He compared the piece of toe-jam with the shrunken city of New York: it was actually bigger! Snickering with satisfaction the boy slowly and deliberately lowered his finger towards the helpless city...

The people of New York could only look up in terror as the finger descended towards them. In a matter of seconds, the piece of toe-jam filled the entire sky above. They could smell its scent washing over them; they could feel its moist humidity enveloping them like a clammy hand. Closer and closer it came, until it finally reached the tops of the highest skyscrapers. The tall buildings began to sway and crumble under the immense pressure...

Stephan casually began to rub the little piece of crud into the city. He could feel the slight sensation of the city being crushed beneath his fingertip. He was hardly even exerting any pressure, but New York was just so tiny and fragile! He gently stirred the toe-jam some more, mixing it in with the remains of the once-mighty city. The remains of skyscrapers, city blocks and parkland became deeply embedded in the smelly, sticky mass. Millions of microscopic people were now mixed in with it, scarcely more than germs or bacteria. The tiny city had been completely crushed and absorbed by an ordinary piece of toe-jam on the end of a 13-year old boy’s finger!

Even now, Stephan’s punishment was incomplete. He was still hot and sweaty from the heat of the day, and his t-shirt was clinging uncomfortably to his skin. Wiping the speck of crud onto his knee for a moment, he pulled off the drenched t-shirt and tossed it aside. Stephan snickered: the best part was yet to come. He collected the now-populated toe-jam once more and lifted up his arm, exposing one armpit. He took a careful sniff: it was ripe with body-odor and glistening with sweat. The boy lifted up the piece of crud and wiped it slowly across the surface of his armpit, using it almost like a sponge to soak up every droplet of sweat. Soon the piece of toe-jam had been reduced to an even more soggy, saturated mass; many of the tiny people were drowned, but there were still millions left in the drenched wreckage of New York, trying desperately to survive in the horrific conditions of the boy’s armpit, terrified at what might happen to them next...
1133111111.title: Divine punishment!

choices: Stephan Speeds Up Time and Makes Himself Reappear in Class the Next Day to Grow
11331111112.content:
Stephan wiped the glob of sticky, wet, crud out of his armpit using the tip of his index finger, and brought it up to his blue eyes. Any remaining people in his armpit were left unnoticed or uncared for by Stephan as he put his arm down and they were either crushed or smothered. Stephan stared at the miniscule blob stuck to the tip of his finger, knowing he had no more use for NYC now that it was rendered down to a soggy microscopic ball of crud and sweat, this thirteen year old god of size found himself bored with it. Regardless of whether he had the godly powers to undo what he'd done by turning back time for the city, or even snap his fingers and cause the city and all its inhabitants to be placed back where the landmass had been before. Stephan then got a devious, although it would be considered disgusting to anyone other than a young mischievous boy, idea.

Without a word, the young god of size opened his mouth and popped the tip of his finger into his mouth, there was so much crud and sweat coating the tiny city, that that was most of what he got as he sloshed the microbes and remaining buildings around his mouth. Still, the satisfaction of what he was doing made the taste not as bad as it would have been normally. Tilting his head back, Stephan swallowed mightily, sighing as he felt a few specks of crud and maybe some people get washed down his throat, he burped proudly and laughed evilly. "That settles that!"

Stephan turned on the news, people were still flustered over how New York had just vanished. Feeling in the mood to tease the mere mortals a bit, Stephan snapped his fingers just as the reporter was in the gap left by the missing NYC. Without a sound, the city reappeared, seemingly right on top of the reporter! Stephan laughed so hard tears streamed down his face, the look on the news anchors faces were priceless! What was best was that he'd made sure that the people had no memory of where they'd been! As Stephan wiped a few tears away from his cheek, he got another idea, he put on his shoes, socks and shirt and stepped outside into the fading daylight.
11331111112.title: Stephan Eats The Big Apple

choices: Stephan Has Some Fun Once He Reaches His Desired Height of 50 ft.
Stephan Grows So Big That His Feet Can Cover Entire Buildings!
113311111121.content:
(My Bad, I said it was the weekend in a previous chapter, so pretend that he skips to Monday.)

Stephan didn't even need to concentrate, he just thought it and it was Monday and he was in English class instantly. Smirking, he waited for an opportunity for everyone's attention to be on him, it was only a matter of time, he had purposely made it so that he was late today, the teacher just hadn't bitched him out yet.

"Now," The teacher turned around from the blackboard and stared daggers at Stephan, "I'm oh so glad you could take time out of your busy schedule to join us today." Sarcasm dripped from the man's voice, and the students snickered as they turned around to stare at the offending student: Stephan O Sullivan.

Stephan simply folded his arms behind his head and kicked his feet up on his desk, which was riddled with crude drawings and curse words. Flexing his toes inside his shoes, knowing that they would all be between them and very sorry they'd ever crossed a god like him shortly. "Get your feet off of your desk Stephan!" The teacher, growing red in the face at Stephan's arrogance and how he seemed to be laid back even though he was supposed to be embarrassed in front of the whole class.

Stephan just smirked at the man, the guy didn't like that look, there was something about it that seemed less mischievous than usual and more....sadistic and knowing. "Hmph...make me, shorty!"

With those words, Stephan's desk began to creak under his increasing weight, the students and teacher stood there dumbfounded as the troublemaker's head smashed through the roof, and his booming laughter could be heard throughout the countryside.
113311111121.title: Time Skipping

choices: Stephan decides to work up a sweat by going for a run
Stephan grows again until his feet can cover entire cities!
1133111111212.content:
Still growing, Stephan stepped out of the ruined building and onto the street that ran next to the school. As he expanded parked cars crumpled against his sneakers and passers-by fled in panic. The teenage titan kept a check on his progress by comparing the size of his foot with the main school building, and once he had reached the point where the school could fit completely beneath the sole of one shoe Stephan brought his growth to a halt.

He peered down into the little wrecked classroom far below. He could just make out the figures of his teacher and former classmates gazing up in fear and disbelief. Slowly and deliberately, like a parody of a cheesy monster horror movie, Stephan raised one mighty foot and and brought it over the tiny school, casting it into deep shadow. Then, equally ponderously, the foot descended...

As the fragile concrete and brickwork began to collapse under the immense pressure the main door was flung open and his former classmates—the only ones with sufficient warning to escape in time—began to spill out into the road. Stephan laughed at the sight and put his full weight down on the school. He heard a slight *crack* as the hated institution was obliterated, followed by a faint cunching sound as he pivoted his foot back and forth, grinding the debris deep into the treads of his sneakers.

Meanwhile the group of survivors had begun running down the street, desperate to get as far from the giant as possible. Stephan’s other foot abruptly slammed down in front of them, halting their progress.

“Not so fast, guys! I haven’t finished with you yet!”

The boy-god inspected the group with an expression of scorn. “You’ll have to do, I suppose. You were the only ones to get out in time so I guess you must be the strongest and fastest. Survival of the fittest, after all!” Stephan paused for a moment to let his words sink in and then continued. “Don’t worry, I’m not going to squish you—yet—provided you do what I tell you. I have something special in mind!”

The giant troublemaker held out one hand and a small glass vial appeared in his palm. He placed it open on the ground and commanded the tiny class to step inside. However, when the teacher moved to follow his students into the gigantic container Stephan quickly pinched him between his fingers and lifted him high into the air.

“You, on the other hand, are pretty worthless.”

Stephan watched the tiny man squirm helplessly between his thumb and forefinger. He'd hated his Engish teacher ever since the man had humiliated him in front of the rest of the class for reading the wrong chapter for homework by mistake. The young giant’s eyes glittered with malice and the teacher began to shrink, tinier and tinier, until he was nothing more than a minute speck trying not to fall into the canyon-deep whorls on Stephan’s index finger. It was entirely fitting, considering the man had once tried to belittle him, that he should be made to feel as small as possible in front of the others. Stephan watched him struggle for a moment—and then casually dropped him inside the vial along with the students.

The titan screwed the lid on the vial, then brought it up to his face to look inside. A couple of his former classmates were yelling and beating their fists against the thick transparent plastic; however, most of the others were now fighting over who got to play with the minuscule, terrified teacher. Stephan grinned at them, then stuffed the vial and its contents inside his pocket as he considered what to do next.
1133111111212.title: Stephan Grows So Big That His Feet Can Cover En...

choices: Stephen modifies the entire Earth to be able to accomodate his growth
Stephen grows with the Earth as-is, even though this may crush the entire planet
11331111112122.content:
"Looks like summer came a little early this year!" boomed the 1,000 ft tall boy whose voice could be heard 100 miles away.

Stephen lifted his foot off the wreckage that had once been a school, but was now a boy's footprint compressed several feet down into the earth. Most of his classmates, including some who were his friends, along with his teachers were compacted and dead down below. Those who managed to escape were now trapped in a vial in his backpocket. In a way they might consider themselves lucky, because in Stephen's pocket they were safe from just about anything, which was more than could be said for the world below....

School was in the past, and Stephen turned his attention to bigger and better things. Crushing an entire building full of hundreds of people with his feet was an amazing feeling, and Stephen yearned for more. If crushing one building could be so awesome, what would it be like to crush hundreds of similar buildings at the same time? In order to do that, Stephen would have to get bigger. Much bigger. But before he grew any further, he needed to decide which city he should target.

The city of New York (or what was left of it) was slowly dissolving in his stomach acid, so crushing that under foot wasn't an option. Fortunately, there was no shortage of other cities all over the world, but because Stephen was a god, he wouldn't settle for just any city. It had to be the biggest and the best. "Tokyo!" Stephen exclaimed as he vanished, much to the bewilderment of onlookers.

At the same moment, thousands of miles away, thousands of Japanese found the sun had suddenly been blocked out by an enormous object. As they turned their heads up to see what this was, they began to scream in terror at the sight of a 1000ft American boy grinning down at them.

Stephen was still the same height as he was before he had teleported, but even so he had teleported on top of several apartment buildings and had instantly snuffed out the lives of hundreds of Japanese men, women, and children beneath the soles of his sneakers. Even this many deaths was a great tragedy, but unfortunately for the people of Japan things were about to get much, much worse.

Stephen began wriggling his sweaty toes within his musty old sneakers in delight as he felt the souls of the Japanese people he had crushed become imprisoned for eternity within the sweaty stench of his soles. This was a horrible after life that was worse than any hell that anyone could possibly imagine, but Stephen was a god and he loved to imprison souls within his soles. He was about to send millions more to this horrible smelly fate.

Tokyo was Stephen's target because he was familiar with the Godzilla movies and would often fantasize about what it would be like to be a giant monster attacking Japan. Now he was living this dream, and it felt wonderful. Stephen also learned in school that Tokyo was the world's largest city with over 34 million people. So when it came to cities there was no greater prize in the entire world than Tokyo Japan. If Stephen could grow large enough to crush Tokyo under his foot, then he could do the same with any other city without breaking a sweat.

But the Greater Tokyo Area covers a really massive area, so in order to be able to do this, Stephan will have to get big. REALLY BIG.
11331111112122.title: Stephan grows again until his feet can cover en...

choices: He keeps using the perspective trick until NA is no bigger than a grain of sand
He transforms North America into a delicious (and still fully populated) cookie
113311111121221.content:
Stephan knew what he wanted to do. However, he was already starting to wonder about the potential problems of getting too big on the surface of the planet - or at least until he finally outgrew it completely and could hold the entire globe comfortably in his hands. Fortunately, he was now a god and didn't have to worry about annoying things such as the laws of physics. All that mattered was visualising in his mind precisely what he wanted to happen and the Universe would somehow adapt to satisfy his needs.

Stephan's school lessons hadn't been entirely wasted upon him. He remembered being told how, centuries ago, people had once believed that the world was flat. "But what if it really was?" Stephan wondered. And with that thought he exerted his power and the world immediately began to change. A great fissure appeared in the middle of the Pacific Ocean and the lithosphere slowly began to unwrap itself from the rest of the planet, like an orange slowly being unpeeled. He brought his thumb and forefinger up close to his eye and positioned them so that it seemed from his perspective that all of North America was being held, pinched, between them. "Galaxies are huge clusters of stars. They come in a variety of shapes, ranging from spirals to irregular clumps. The smallest contain tens of millions of stars, while the largest can have as many as a hundred trillion! We live a medium-sized one that probably consists of two or three billion stars. From here on Earth our galaxy appears as a band stretching across the sky, but according to Greek mythology this was actually a splash of milk from the breast of the goddess Hera - and that is how the galaxy got its game."

As the rest of the class of adolescents tittered slightly at the mention of the goddess's breast, Stephan sighed. He'd heard all this before and was impatient to get to the good stuff.

However, I've brought in something special today to illustrate it clearly." Stephan snapped back to attention as the teacher picked up a object from his desk. He couldn't see it clearly, but it looked like some kind of glass box, about 12cm on each side, with a tiny white shape inside.

"As part of the National Schools' Science Foundation we've been loaned this exhibit, which is the most accurate model of our galaxy yet created." The teacher handed the object to one of the kids at the front so that it could be passed around the class. "It's a 3D representation of the Milky Way, made using the latest astronomical data. The exact positions of more than 80,000 known stars have been etched inside a block of crystal. What you are holding in your hands right now is pretty much the Milky Way as we know it!"

As the girl in front of him turned round to hand him the crystal Stephan smiled. A whole galaxy in the palm of his hand sounded like exactly what he wanted! He narrowed his eyes and began to concentrate.

On the other side of the world it was still night, but among those who were still awake were the legions of astronomers, hard at work studying the heavens while the darkness lasted. They had already been startled by the recent news reporting the mysterious unexplained disappearance of the entire city of New York - but that was as nothing compared to the latest surprise. Without warning the sky lit up! It was as though morning had come, even though it was still the middle of the night... and the sun was not even in the sky! The light was everywhere, waking everybody on the planet, sending them rushing out in to the streets to look up in terror. The moon and the stars had disappeared in the glare; even the sun was all but drowned out by the brightness on what was formerly the "day" side of the planet. Astronomers rushed to interpret the latest data from their orbital telescopes, and reports were quickly sent to all the world leaders....

"The stars are still there, but... the light seems to be coming from beyond them... we think it's from somewhere outside the galaxy itself! And not just outside it; everywhere around it! Everything beyond that has simply disappeared, apart from what appear almost to be immense reflections that must be thousands or millions of light years across. It's almost as though.... it's almost as though our whole galaxy was inside some kind of impossibly huge glass box!"

But then the light on one side of the planet was blocked out and a new shape appeared, fillling the sky completely. It was so huge that it took a while for people to actually recognise what it was. And when they did... a wave of hysteria spread across the world. Unbelievably titanic, studying them from beyond the most distant stars was a huge, HUGE eye! From its sheer scale scientists could only speculate that it might be as big as an entire galaxy. Then the eye slowly pulled back revealing more of a giant male face. Still holding the small glass box containing the model, Stephan smirked. Unbeknownst to anybody else, the tiny shape inside the crystal had undergone a subtle transformation. "Okay class, today we will be learning about the bloodiest war mankind has ever fought." said the teacher. "This war began in Europe in the year 1939, when an evil dictator by the name of Adolf Hitler invaded Poland and set his sights on conquering the entire world."

This talk of conquering the entire world didn't help much to relieve Stephen's aching erection as he continued daydreaming about the squashed city of NYC under his sweaty feet, or the billions of stars in his pocket. There right in front of his desk materialized the enormous country of Nazi Germany, except it was no longer quite so enormous as it was now roughly the same size as a dinner plate. 1133221112121.content:
So preoccupied was Stephan with gloating over his new plaything that he scarcely even noticed the momentary pause in the class. He was oblivious to the fact that the decor of the classroom had subtly altered; that a couple of his classmates had been replaced by entirely different kids; that the hair of the girl sitting in front of him had darkened from light blonde to chestnut brown. He didn’t even care that the teacher had broken off with a confused expression on his face, as though trying to re-capture his train of thought. A moment later the man shrugged in puzzlement and returned to his intended topic of the greatest mystery in human history: the complete disappearance of the German nation in 1939.

Little did he know that the nation in question was even now laid out on a desk at the back of the class in front of his most troublesome student, miniaturized to an utterly minute scale and completely powerless despite its military build-up. In fact, so small was it that a casual observer would likely have mistaken the tiny nation for nothing more than some kind of novelty mouse mat—just the thing a school kid might own. Lying open on the desk next to the miniaturized landmass was Stephan’s history book, perhaps some 200 miles thick compared to the microscopic Nazis. And inside the textbook, where Germany had once appeared on the map, there was now just a blank space with a dotted outline marking its prior location. The text on the opposite page had also changed and now listed some of the most popular theories for the incredible disappearance of the entire country on the eve of what had been feared at the time to be a potential invasion of Poland. The theories were inevitably vague and unsatisfactory, but one of the more outlandish suggestions caught Stephan’s eye. He thrust his hand into the air, interrupting the teacher.

“Sir! It says here that many people think GOD took Germany. What’s that all about?”

The teacher was slightly irritated by the interjection, but he figured he might as well answer since it was a rare event for Stephan to show any interest in class.

“Certain more vocal religious groups have speculated that Germany offended the Lord with its wicked nature and was therefore completely removed from the world.”

“Removed?” asked Stephan innocently and with a slight smile on his face. “You mean, like God just reached down and grabbed it? Why would he do something like that.”

The teacher frowned slightly at the boy’s simplistic description. “I suppose the Church believes that it was to punish Germany.”

“Wow. So he just took a whole country full of people. Like it was nothing. That’s so cool.” Stephan smiled again and glanced briefly down at the country in question. Under the desk his crotch was throbbing from the sight of the “toy” nation and the casual way in which he had played the part of “God”. Now he just needed to complete the theory by "punishing" it...

This time the teacher’s frown was clear and unmistakable. “ ‘Cool’ is hardly an appropriate word, Stephan. Remember, thousands of innocent men, women and children vanished along with the Nazi regime. And that’s why this theory is so ridiculous—do you think they also deserved to be punished by God?”

Stephan didn’t bother to answer: he was too busy studying the phenomenal detail of the miniature landmass before him, with its miniscule geography and cities like sprinklings of dust. Those of the microscopic population who were brave enough to look up at the country-sized face of the teenage boy would have noticed a momentary glow in his eyes. Once again there was a slight pause as the world around Stephan reshaped itself to adapt to a slightly different version of history—one in which all the innocent citizens were miraculously transported away to live their lives safely in neighbouring countries.

As the teacher returned to his lecture Stephan took a stick of glue from his school bag and applied a thin film of adhesive to the blank patch on the map. Then he carefully picked up the tiny country in both hands, doing his best not to crush too much of it beneath his colossal fingertips. It was so light and fragile that he knew it would take barely any pressure to simply snap it in two or grind it into a ball of dirt between his hands—but he had other plans, at least for now. Stephan concentrated instead and began shrinking the little nation once more. This time he deliberately made sure the process was relatively slow so that he could enjoy the sight of the once-huge landmass getting smaller and smaller by the second, and actually feel the sensation of it dwindling in his grasp. Soon Germany was tiny enough to rest on one hand, and by the time Stephan judged it to be small enough for his purposes the entire country was nestling right in the centre of his palm and was barely an inch across at its widest point. He was rock hard from the overwhelming sense of power and the knowledge that he had millions of people in the palm of his hand. Fighting an overwhelming desire to just close his fist around it and crush it he pinched the teeny little nation gingerly between the thumb and forefinger of his other hand, picked it up, and carefully lowered it down onto the page of his textbook, rotating and fitting it neatly within the dotted outline of where Germany—the printed version—had once been. The glue took effect immediately, holding the trillions of tons of abducted continental bedrock in place as though the landmass was as flimsy as a leaf or sticker (which of course it now was). The map of Europe in Stephan’s textbook was complete once more, but now with the actual, real, living Nazi Germany in place of the illustration.

Stephan leaned back, highly pleased with his work. Now the Nazis could have all the “Lebensraum” they desired and even spread out across the entire page if they wished, while the rest of the world would be spared. It amused the boy-god greatly to imagine the Nazi troops marching into Poland—to find just a vast bare expanse of coloured paper, populated only by micro-organisms. Perhaps that would be the true war for the now-microscopic humans: battling to survive against encroaching microbes and bacteria that threatened to devour them. Stephan liked the idea: it would certainly be more entertaining to study than World War II. He idly probed the inside of one nostril with his pinky finger and then carelessly wiped it on the map next to the German border, leaving a faintly glistening smear of mucus ready for the armies to blunder into.

However, Stephan wasn’t known for his lengthy attention span and wasn’t sure if he could really be bothered to continue playing with them. There were surely other toys to find...

The city of New York had been badly damaged by the teenage giant who had cruelly abducted their city and tormented them in his smelly sneaker. Many buildings had been reduced to rubble, and thousands if not millions of people had been killed. To make matters worse, when the city finally did escape from the stinky shoe and the people found themselves in the light of day, they were immediately attacked by a vast army of Germans from WW2.

Even though New York had the benefit of modern technology, there were very few soldiers in the city and very few weapons with which to fight back. Aside from the NYPD and Gangs there was no one in the city who could fight back against the invading Germans, so most people fled to their homes or simply surrendered.

The Nazis quickly began to round up all Black, Hispanic, Jewish, and Asian citizens and began to march them back to Germany where they would be put in concentration camps and used as slave labor before eventually being killed off.

Fortunately, before this could happen things suddenly changed and the city of New York as well as all of its people began to grow and grow, and as the city grew it began to swallow up the entire country of Germany. To the Americans it seemed as if the Germans were shrinking, but in reality they were exactly the same size and it was the Americans who had grown until each American towered over the Germans like a skyscraper, and the Skyscrapers of New York were the size of cities, and New York itself was like a continent.

The thousands of Black, Hispanic, Jewish, and Asian Americans who were being marched off into Germany suddenly found themselves towering like Gullivers over a vast landscape full of tiny buildings, Farmlands, roads, and people. The German soldiers who had been marching them at gunpoint were now the size of insects, and their puny weapons were now barely capable of even hurting them, let alone killing them.

Realizing this, the American prisoners stopped marching and began to fight back. They didn't have any weapons, but because they were hundreds of feet tall they didn't even need any. The tiny German soldiers screamed in terror and began firing their weapons to no effect as the vast shadows of American shoes fell over them before squishing them deep into the ground. 113322111212121112.content:
The Kohen siblings Sarah, 17 years old, and Jake, 15 years old, were already in Germany when the size changing occurred. Being boy and girl, they had recently just been separated from each other, in order to be taken to concentration camps. Then, all of a sudden, their entire surroundings started to diminish in size. Buildings, trees, and even the soldiers aiming at them, all got smaller and smaller fast. Before they could realize what was going on, Sarah and Jake, along with some other Americans, were now surrounded by hundreds of bug-sized Germans.

The first ones to react were the Germans, as they were the more startled ones by the change of scenario. Seeing their hostages suddenly shoot up to the sky made them realize immediately how threatening they could be now. So, without giving it a second thought, they started attacking the giant Jews.

One problem the Germans quickly found themselves into was the lack of powerful weapons. Not only were the military technology much less advanced at the time, but these soldiers were only taking unarmed hostages to concentration camps, which meant that their weapons were reduced to a few weak hand guns, like Walther P38 or Luger P08 pistols. However, they didn't have much choice, so they opened fire at the giant Americans, anyway.

Sarah and Jake, along with the rest of the Americans around, stared down for a few seconds at the tiny Germans attacking them. Jake was wearing jeans and sneakers, so the diminutive bullets weren't even felt by him. Sarah, on the other hand, was wearing shorts and sandals, so the pelting of Nazi bullets against her skin were surely noticed, even if they only felt like sparklers sparkles when they're held close to someone's hand.

After the initial shock, both siblings reacted. Jake, being a teenage boy, immediately fought back against the Germans. Stamping on them as if he was standing on an ant hill, he used both his huge sneakers to attack his former captors. Seeing their attacks do nothing against him only encouraged Jake to continue fighting the people who were about to murder him.

Sarah, on the other hand, was just as angry, but her reaction was different. The tiny bullets tickled her feet and ankles, but she was in no mood of laughing. Annoyed by the constant tickling of the German weapons, she stamp on them a couple of times, to at least decrease the amount of tickling on her feet. But instead of staying to fight, as her brother did, she immediately thought about the concentration camps they were about to be sent to, and about all the Jews already held captive there.

Without hesitating, Sarah stepped over the ring of soldiers surrounding her and proceeded towards the nearby concentration camps, intending to release as many Jews as possible before they were killed.

Which sibling do we follow now?

11332212121.content:
“... softball-sized!”

Why a softball? In fact, Stephan’s keen eyes had already noticed something going on outside the window. A group of older kids were playing softball, and that gave Stephan a great idea...

Once again, Planet Earth and the seven billion people (more or less) living on it were transported into Stephan’s waiting palm. This time the tiny planet was enclosed within a transparent protective shield: the boy wanted to make sure the population survived for as long as possible. Nevertheless, while a good proportion of the southern hemisphere was saved from being crushed against Stephan’s palm, it was still cast into utter darkness, while the countries in the north could only look up at their new god’s face smirking down at them. Mass hysteria gripped the planet as it began to dawn on the miniaturized human race where they now were.

They didn’t have to worry about it for long.

The Earth abruptly vanished from Stephan’s palm... only to reappear in the grip of another, even bigger titan: the pitcher of the softball match. A fraction of a second later the tiny Earth was launched into the air and send flying towards the waiting bat. If the batter was aware that the previously white softball had changed to a mixture of blue, green and white he certainly didn’t have time to react, except by instinct. He hit the “ball”.

*THWACK*

The tiny Earth was instantly obliterated by the force of the bat, exploding in a messy shower of dirt, water, and minute blobs of semi-solid magma. The shocked kids crowded round the debris in confusion, poking at the fragments with their toes, unaware they were crushing the shattered remains of entire continents beneath their sneakers.

Stephan laughed uproariously at the sight, totally loving the prank he had just played on an entire inhabited world. It made him all the more eager to experiment further.
The rest of the afternoon was nothing less than a living hell for the human race—at least that “copy” of the human race that Stephan had brought into being to be his personal toy. The boy-god brought them back again and again at a variety of different sizes, only to be destroyed in some cruel and inventive manner. Not only that, he also arranged for the memory of each catastrophe to carry over: the human race was fully aware of every punishment that had been inflicted upon them while remaining utterly powerless to prevent the next.

Over the next couple of hours Stephan dropped the tiny planet into a beaker of acid and watched it slowly dissolve; he used a pen to scrawl “I AM GOD” across several continents, crushing everything underneath; he used a straw to suck up all the oceans... and then finished by sucking up the atmosphere (and much of the population) too. After that last little game he decided to experiment further by turning the Earth into a ball of candy, with a soft strawberry filling replacing the core. He popped the teeny planet inside his mouth and sucked on it thoughtfully. Of course the population died almost instantly, but Stephan was more interested in savouring the unique flavours of the continents as they were abraded away by his tongue and dissolved in his saliva. To his disappointment the planet felt surprisingly bland beneath his taste-buds. He’d hoped to enjoy the fragile textures of the mountain ranges and ocean trenches, but sadly even the tallest mountains on Earth were so microscopically tiny by comparison to the boy-god that the Earth might as well have been a highly-polished pool ball, completely without discernible features. Oh well.

As a punishment for that disappointment the Earth’s next destination was inside the mouth of one of Stephan’s buddies. Mike was busy scarfing down a bag of M&Ms and it took but a casual flick of the fingers for the planet to rematerialize inside the bag. Stephan then watched as Mike tipped the remainder of the bag into his mouth and smiled in satisfaction as the teeny Earth rolled between Mike’s teeth and was crushed a moment later beneath a gigantic molar.

Stephan brought the games to a conclusion by wandering into another Geography class. He wasn’t really supposed to be there, but who was there who could stop him? Moreover, the teacher, Mr. Wheezely, was a short-sighted old dinosaur who was counting the days until retirement. And his desk was an ordinary classroom globe, of the kind that were used in schools everywhere...

A boy sitting at the back of the class was unexpectedly reduced to half a millimeter in size right where he sat and Stephan slid into his place, crushing the tiny mite without a second thought. Instead, the boy-god focused his attention on the globe and was rewarded a moment later by a slight gasp and low murmurings from the rest of the class. Now the actual planet Earth rested on the teacher’s desk, with a metal bar, thousands of miles long, punched right through the poles and core to hold the little thing in place and allow it to be casually rotated.

And rotated it was.

Again and again Mr. Wheezely’s hand descended from the heavens, sending the tiny Earth spinning helplessly. Each time his hand touched the surface it gauged immense trenches across the continents, while towns and villages, along with millions of people, were scooped up to find new homes deep under the already-dirty fingernails of the shambling, short-sighted old Geography teacher. Each time his finger stabbed down to point out the location of a major city, that entire metropolis was obliterated in a trice. Los Angeles, New York, London, Tokyo... all were nothing more than tiny little specks ground into dust beneath a mighty fingertip.

At the end of the class many of the kids went up to the desk to examine the mysterious blue and white globe... but by then it had changed back to its original form. The actual planet was now in Stephan’s cupped palm where it belonged. By now he was starting to lose interest, but maybe there was time for one final prank.
